description.narrative: To strengthen the capacity of key public sector institutions to improve the contribution of energy and mineral resources to accelerated national economic growth and increased social and environmental sustainability in a context of globalization and technological change.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Article 5, 5.01 | Description :Adoption of Operational Manual | Due Date :21-Mar-2012
Finance Agreement :Article 5, 5.01 | Description :Signing of the Subsidiary Agreement with CEPEL | Due Date :01-Jun-2012
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section 1 | Description :Creation and maintenance of the Co-executing Units in each of theParticipating Entities | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section 1 | Description :Creation of the PMU | Due Date :13-Sep-2011
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section 1 | Description :Creation of the Project Steering Committee | Due Date :13-Sep-2011
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section 1 | Description :Environmental and Social Management Framework | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section 1 | Description :Signing of subsidiary agreement with a Participating Entity (other thanCEPEL) before carrying out any project activity under the administrative jurisdiction of a Participating Entity | Due Date:20-Jun-2013
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, section V | Description :Appointement of a procurement officer 3 months after effectiveness | DueDate :31-Jul-2012

title.narrative: Enhancement of capacity of key Government institutions in charge of supporting the development of both the energy and mineral sectors
Improve the capacity of the Ministry and the Energy Planning Agency (EPE) to define the potential of wind energy that can be integrated to the grid
Improve the management and security of documents related to mineral rights
Reduction of energy used due to the implementation of demand response measures
Improved capacity of the CPRM to create maps of the geophysical risk susceptibility
Development of internal capacity to execute an annual inventory of GHG emissions
Application of phaser synchronization measurement technologies
Enhancement of applied sectoral R&D laboratories
Improve capacity of MME to contribute effectively in south-south cooperation
Adjust the structure of SGM to the new legal and regulatory framework, and create the CNPM
Nb of entities created or restructured
Improve the primary data on small-scale mining
high-performance computer model to support expansion planning and operation of the SIN
Nb of power transmission technologies developed and/or deployed
Nb of new methodologies created and utilized
Nb of new database created and utilized for planning and socio-environmental monitoring
Apply newly-collected and processed energy-use data to improve energy models.
